articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Israel and Iran launched fresh attacks on each other late on Saturday, stoking fears of a wider conflict after Israel expanded its surprise campaign against its main rival with a strike on the world's biggest gas field.
articles.title: Israel and Iran strike at each other in new wave of attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The latest round of U.S.-Iran nuclear talks scheduled for Sunday in Muscat will not take place, Omani Foreign Minister Badr Albusaidi said on X on Saturday. Oman has been mediating the talks.
articles.title: Sunday's U.S.-Iran nuclear talks cancelled, Oman says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency said on Saturday Iran's Nuclear Regulatory Authority had informed it there was no change in off-site radiation levels in Isfahan, site of one of the nuclear targets struck on Friday by Israeli forces.
articles.title: IAEA says Iran finds no radiation increase at Isfahan

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Nationwide protests against President Donald Trump, tensions in the Middle East amid Israel's strikes on Iran and expected rainy weather in Washington on Saturday could dampen spirits at a military parade on the U.S. Army's 250th anniversary, set to feature tanks on the streets and aircraft flying overhead.
articles.title: Protests, Middle East - and bad weather - may rain on Trump's military parade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities said the gunman was impersonating a police officer and escaped after exchanging fire with police. Gov. Tim Walz called the shootings politically motivated assassination.
articles.title: Minnesota state lawmakers shot, one killed, search underway for suspect, state governor says

articles.author: Michel Rose
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron will visit Greenland on Sunday, in a show of solidarity with Denmark meant to send a signal of European resolve after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to take over the island.
articles.title: Macron visits Greenland to signal European resolve after Trump annexation threats

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's president said that troops maintained their defensive lines along more than 1,000 kilometers of the front.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukraine halts Russian troop advance in Sumy region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moscow did not receive any of its war dead from Kyiv, Russian state media reported.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners of war, but Moscow received no war dead, Russia says

articles.author: Sumit Khanna, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: Doctors were working overtime to gather dental samples from the deceased to run identification checks and DNA profiling.
articles.title: Air India crash death toll hits 270, families wait for bodies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 100 people have been killed in an attack by gunmen on a village in Nigeria's central Benue state, Amnesty International Nigeria said Saturday.
articles.title: Gunmen kill at least 100 people in Nigeria's Benue state, Amnesty International says
